Dear ___,

I hope this letter finds you in good spirits. I am writing to provide you with the details of your recent hospital stay and medical management at our facility.

You were admitted on March 10, 2024, following a fall that resulted in the subsequent loss of consciousness. Upon admission, your Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) was recorded at 11, and slurring of speech was noted. A CT scan performed on March 11, 2024, confirmed the presence of an intracerebral hemorrhage located in the right hemisphere, classified under diagnosis code I61.9.

Throughout your stay, we conducted several tests, including a complete blood count (CBC) and a coagulation profile on March 11, 2024. The CBC showed that your hemoglobin was slightly low with an elevated white blood cell count while the coagulation profile indicated an elevated INR, suggesting a prolonged bleeding time which is crucial information for managing your condition.

Management included administering Mannitol at a dose of 0.25 g/kg every 6 hours to manage cerebral edema and antihypertensive medications tailored according to your blood pressure readings. Despite these interventions, there was no significant immediate improvement in your neurological status, and your GCS remained at 11.

Daily assessments indicated persistent slurred speech and right-sided weakness. On March 12, 2024, discussions were held with your family to outline the prognosis and address ongoing care needs given your critical condition.

Throughout your hospitalization, our team took every measure to ensure your safety and comfort, implementing precautions to prevent further falls, particularly during episodes of agitation and confusion.

Your condition necessitates close monitoring, and hence, discharge plans include further discussions on care continuation either at home with support or at a specialized care facility, depending on the subsequent improvement in your health status.

Please ensure a follow-up with your primary care physician and any specialists involved in your care for an in-depth review of your progress. If you have any questions or concerns in the meantime, do not hesitate to reach out to us.

Wishing you a steady recovery and strength as you focus on your rehabilitation. Thank you for placing your trust in our care. We are here for any support you may need on your journey to recovery.

Sincerely,

Dr. ___
